swefun.cardgames.playingcards

Class Deck

  • java.lang.Object
    • swefun.cardgames.playingcards.Deck
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Card>

    public class Deck
extends Object
implements Iterable<Card>
    Represents a deck of playing cards. Position indices are zero-based, such that index 0 represents the "top" of a non-empty deck.
    Version:
    1.4 $Id: Deck.java 295 2017-03-24 21:26:19Z jody $
    Author:
    Dr. Jody Paul

      Constructs a deck with references to cards provided by the parameter.

      • size

        Returns:

      • getCard

        public Card getCard(int which)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the card at the specified position

      • add

        public boolean add(Card newCard)
        Adds the specified card to the bottom of this deck. Note that this makes no requirement as to whether or not the specified card already exists in the deck; thus, duplicate references may result.
        Parameters:
        newCard - the card to be added
        Returns:
        true if the contents of the deck was changed

      • add

        public void add(int index,
                Card newCard)
        Inserts the specified card at the specified position in this deck. Shifts the card at the specified index (if any) and any subsequent cards one position to the right (increments their indices by one).
        Parameters:
        index - index at which the specified card is to be inserted
        newCard - the card to be added
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index > this.size())

      • remove

        public boolean remove(Card card)
        Removes the specified card from this deck if it is present. If this deck does not contain the card, the deck is unchanged.

        More formally, removes the card with the lowest index i such that (card==null ? get(i)==null : card.equals(get(i))) (if such an element exists).

        Returns true if this list contained the specified element (or equivalently, if this list changed as a result of the call).

        Parameters:
        card - the card to be removed
        Returns:
        true if the contents of the deck was changed

      • remove

        public Card remove(int index)
        Removes the card at the specified position in this deck. Shifts any subsequent cards one position to the left (decrements their indices by one). Returns the card that was removed from the list.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the card to be removed
        Returns:
        the card previously at the specified position
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= this.size())

      • setCard

        public Card setCard(int which,
                    Card inCard)
        Specifies the card at a given position by exchanging cards. Puts the card currently at that position into the position vacated by the specified card. Behavior maintains the integrity of the deck; that is, the deck contains the same cards before and after invocation of this method.

        Preconditions:

        • The specified card must already exist within the deck.
        • The specified position must be valid
        Behavior when preconditions are not met is undefined. Exceptions may be thrown if preconditions are not met.
        Parameters:
        which - Location in which to put specified card
        inCard - The specified Card
        Returns:
        The card now at the indicated position

      • iterator

        public Iterator<Card> iterator()
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface Iterable<Card>

      • deal

        public Card deal()
        Removes the card from the beginning of the deck.
        Returns:
        the card that was at the beginning of the deck; null if deck contains no cards

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle()
        Performs a simple shuffle by exchanging cards. Uses Collections.shuffle(List)

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns string representation of every card in this deck and in the order they appear in the deck.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        displayable string for this deck

        public boolean equals(Object obj)
        Overridden equals method: number and order of equivalent cards must be the same.
